column4: guys need some help. just installed apache2 on jaunty. /var/www was owned by root. i changed this to www-data and added group+w permission. added my user secondary group to be www-data. verified everything. now as i test it i cant create a file into /var/www - no permissions it says. where am i wrong? :(( damn it
did you re login to get new group info
should i relogin?
well if id /groups says you are part of that group you should be ok
show the perms on /var/www
are they 775?
see: http://paste.ubuntu.com/170722/
unless I missing something I don't see you a member of www-data?
i dont get it. i just saw it too. but before relogging i used to sudo usermod -a -G www-data eantonoff .... hm. then it showed i was member of www-data. or i did it wrong?

no, I meant if you had other shells open at the time it wouldn't carry over

it will just inherit the groups from the shell it is spawned from
how then should i force it?
either login / logout of gnome
argh...ok. will do :)
or try bash --login
